vulnerability_location.description: External call msg.sender.call.value(_am)() occurs before updating balances[msg.sender], enabling reentrancy
The AddMessage function is declared public with no authorization checks, allowing any external caller to insert arbitrary log entries
balances[msg.sender] += msg.value can overflow without bounds check in Solidity 0.4.19

External calls to TransferLog.AddMessage in Deposit (line 29) and CashOut (line 41), as well as the external msg.sender.call.value(_am)() in CashOut (line 38), can fail or run out of gas and block execution, preventing deposits or withdrawals (denial of service).
Floating pragma (^0.4.19) allows compilation with different compiler versions, leading to inconsistent behavior
